description: This file declares the StateHandler class responsible for managing lifecycle state transitions within the WPEFramework plugin. It includes methods for initializing, changing states, validating transitions, updating states, sending events, and retrieving state paths. The class utilizes external interfaces and data structures such as ApplicationContext, ILifecycleManager, State, and StateTransitionRequest, and maintains static mappings for possible state transitions and state strings.

classes.name: StateHandler
classes.description: A static class providing methods for managing lifecycle state transitions within the plugin, including initialization, transition validation, state updates, and event notifications.

methods.name: initialize
methods.description: Initializes the StateHandler, possibly setting up static data structures or state mappings.

methods.name: changeState
methods.description: Attempts to change the lifecycle state based on a request, returning success or failure along with an error reason.

methods.name: createState
methods.description: Creates a new State object for a given application context and lifecycle state.

methods.name: isValidTransition
methods.description: Checks if transitioning from start to target state is valid based on predefined state sequences.

methods.name: updateState
methods.description: Updates the current application context to a new lifecycle state and reports success or failure.

methods.name: sendEvent
methods.description: Sends an event notification about a lifecycle state change.

methods.name: getStatePath
methods.description: Retrieves the path of states leading to a specified lifecycle state.
